content:
Diagnosis:	Gastric adenocarcinoma with signet ring cell features

Management:	15 Jan 2024 Subtotal gastrectomy

Histology:	pT2N1(2/15)M0 poorly differentiated adenocarcinoma with signet ring cell features, R0 resection. PDL1 CPS 3, MSI stable.

Current Situation:	Cycle 3 CAPOX adjuvant chemotherapy

I reviewed [redacted name] today in the chemotherapy assessment clinic. The first two cycles of adjuvant CAPOX have been well tolerated with only grade 1 nausea and minimal peripheral neuropathy. Blood parameters remain satisfactory with stable renal function. Weight has stabilized at 68kg and nutritional intake is adequate with support from our dietitian. Post-operative recovery continues to progress well with improving exercise tolerance.

I am happy to proceed with cycle 3 CAPOX today as planned. We will arrange CT chest/abdomen/pelvis after cycle 4 for interim disease assessment. Follow-up appointment will be made for 3 weeks' time prior to cycle 4.

primary_cancer.histopathology_status: poorly differentiated adenocarcinoma with signet ring cell features, R0 resection

cancer_timeline.value: Completed cycle 2 CAPOX with good tolerance

patient_facts.value: grade 1 nausea and minimal peripheral neuropathy
blood parameters satisfactory with stable renal function

status_updates.value: Post-operative gastric cancer patient tolerating adjuvant CAPOX chemotherapy well with minimal side effects

proceeding with cycle 3 CAPOX as planned
